keyword: calories in fish and chips chips
title: Calories in Fish and Chips Chips
meta_description: Discover calories in fish and chips chips for a typical 150g serving, including carbs, fat, protein, sodium details, and preparation tweaks.
h1: Calories in Fish and Chips Chips
assumptions: Deep-fried potato french fries (chips) from a traditional fish and chips shop, salted, standard portion ~150g, no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shop, oil type, portion size, and frying method. Check restaurant info or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A 150g serving of fish and chips chips provides ~468 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp tartar sauce per serving
Thinner cut, extra crispy (more oil absorption)

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of fish and chips chips?
faqs.a: About 468 kcal for a typical 150g deep-fried portion.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in fish and chips chips?
faqs.a: Around 62g total carbs in 150g, with 5.7g fiber.

faqs.q: Are fish and chips chips high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, ~915mg in 150g due to salt; varies by preparation.

faqs.q: How does frying affect calories in chips?
faqs.a: Deep-frying adds fat and calories; baking reduces them by ~120 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: Protein in fish and chips chips?
faqs.a: Low at ~5g per 150g serving; mainly from potatoes.
